text: BERLIN, Aug 12 TUI has reached an agreement with the German government on an additional aid package worth 1.2 billion euros ($1.4 billion) to provide sufficient liquidity, the tour operator said on Wednesday as the company is hit by the coronavirus pandemic.The package will help cover TUIs seasonal swing through winter 2020/21 and beyond or if there are long-term travel restrictions and disruptions related to the pandemic, it said in a statement.TUI and state-owned lender KfW agreed to increase an existing credit line by 1.05 billion euros, the company added.
